author: Phenix
title: Great bagged set that looks like a familiar fish..
review:
This is a cool little bagged set we picked up in the gift shop at Sealife park adjacent to Legoland, CA.  


Retail price was $3.49 USD.


My daughter, a legomaniac  that is 8 years old was the builder.


Pros:


- double fins on each side

- dome eyes 

- wiggly tail

- open mouth (can 'eat' instructions!)

- two free Legoland passes (cough! Rip off! Cough cough...) 


Cons: 


- Fins do not rotate (just up and down)

- Bottom is flat vice fish-shaped


All in all, a great set.  Not really any rare pieces, except for possibly orange 3x2 upside down slope.


You can stop by and get this set from the gift shop without paying admission to either park...  Or pick u the child free coupons if you forgot to get tickets before you arrive.  


Oh, and did I mention it looks just like Nemo?  Yeah.  Big selling point for the 4-8 crowd.    =0)

author: legogal
title: What a coooooool clown fish!
review:
WOW! What a neat polybag fish! I landed "Fishy" last weekon eBay and then Bricklink, and want to share a few ideas about it. So this is not an official review....just some random thoughts.

The polybag contains clear instructions, which are a real plus. This makes the build simple; many five year olds could put this together correctly. 

And the design is just stunning, especially if you are into beautiful tropical fish. I love snorkeling with them in warm water, so Fishy brings back lots of great memories from exotic locales. 

This is a hard to find polybag these days, but you can get it on Bricklink at $5US or eBay (if you want to pay much more.) Has anyone seen it in a bricks and mortar store recently? It was given out as a freebie in Europe and sold at some Parks; later it showed up at Five Below, a discounter in the US. But that was over a year ago. 

This is one cute little fishy! Can't wait to put it in our aquarium! Does anyone know if aquarium lights will fade the little guy?

If you need a nice gift for someone who enjoys fish, this could be perfect! Fingers are crossed that LEGO will do more colorful fish in polybags because this is a real winner.

Has anyone built this in other colors? Finding pastel colored parts must have been a bear, but should be worth it. Has anyone seen any other fish this size? Fishy needs as friend or two...
